ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine curled up in his wolf mode, laying still among the debris. he still couldn t see very well, he figured he d use a CR chamber to repair himself when

Lunarpine curled up in his wolf mode, laying still among the debris. 
he still couldn't see very well, he figured he'd use a CR chamber to 
repair himself when some of the others were done. for now the 
Maximals needed able warriors to stand cover in case an enemy should 
decide to attack when they're damaged. His eyes were useless, but his 
sense of smell and his hearing were still 100%, thats all he needed.

The wolf lay still, wondering about Shadow Wing, She cut her repairs 
short to return to the fight, she came out to save him. After his 
repairs were complete he'd appologize. Somehow he couln't get used to 
this group. He was used to the military life, soldiers follow orders, 
these Maximals have more of a social structure than his military life.

His words still echoed through his brain. "Leave the fighting to the 
Killers not the thinkers." She could have taken that as a compliment, 
instead she ran off hurt. "I think maybe I hurt her more than any 
Pred weapon." He hoped she'd get over his stupid angry comment. 

"I wonder if the CR chamber can remove this foot that I stuck in my 
mouth." he was reminded of the crow she'd caught for him. it would be 
a suitable meal right about now.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She was in the CR chamber getting repaired.  She just wanted to get 
> out of there as fast as possable.  She desided to go back to that 
> cave up north.  Only this time, she's be more careful to mask her 
> scent. Sne stay out of scanner range.  If she got into trouble, she 
> face it and get out of it or die.  But she didn't want to come 
back. 
> Not after what he had said to her.  Yes, she would leave the 
killing 
> to the killers.  She felt her spark sink.  But this time, she 
> wouldn't come back.  She just had to wait for the CR chamber to 
> finish.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > I'm fine Wing, why'd you have to go and get hit again?"Lunarpines 
> > accept no help attitude showed Shadow Wing that he was OK, other 
> than 
> > scrambled optics he'd escaped this battle without any major 
damage.
> > 
> > "I could've dodged the shot you know." They both knew that he 
> > couldn't have dodged it, but you'd never catch him admitting it.
> >
